description.p: Bards of the College of Dance know that the Words of Creation can't be contained within speech or song; the words are uttered by the movements of celestial bodies and flow through the motions of the smallest creatures. These Bards practice a way of being in harmony with the whirling cosmos that emphasizes agility, speed, and grace.
Starting at 3rd level, While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a Shield, you gain the following benefits.
Dance Virtuoso: you have Advantage on any Charisma (Performance) check you make that involves you dancing.
Unarmored Defense: your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Charisma modifiers.
Agile Strikes: when you expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration as part of an action, a Bonus Action, or a Reaction, you can make one Unarmed Strike as part of that action, Bonus Action, or Reaction.

Bardic Damage: you can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. When you deal damage with an Unarmed Strike, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die plus your Dexterity modifier, instead of the strike's normal damage. This roll doesn't expend the die.

sheet.description: After each Long Rest, choose one spell list: Arid, Polar, Temperate, Tropical. The Circle Spells are always prepared.

description.p: Starting at 6rd level, when an enemy you can see ends its turn within 5 feet of you, you can take a Reaction and expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to move up to half your Speed. Then one ally of your choice within 30 feet of you can also move up to half their Speed using their Reaction.
None of this feature's movement provokes Opportunity Attacks.

sheet.description: When an enemy ends its turn within 5ft form you, you can move up to half of your speed. One ally of your choice within 30ft of you can also move up to half of his speed using his Reaction. None of this movements provoke Opportunity attacks.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, when you roll Initiative, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration if you don't have the Incapacitated condition. When you do so, roll your Bardic Inspiration die; you and each ally within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you gains a bonus to Initiative equal to the number rolled.

sheet.description: When you roll Initiative, you can expend one Bardic Inspiration. You and any allies within 30ft gain an Initiative bonus equal to the number rolled.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. If any creatures within 5 feet of you are making the same Dexterity saving throw, you can share this benefit with them for that save.
You can't use this feature if you have the Incapacitated condition.

sheet.description: When you are subject to a DEX Saving Throw to halve a damage, you take half damage on a fail and no damage on a save. You can share this ability with any creature within 5ft form you subject to the same effect. You can't use this feature if you are Incapacitated.
You have Advantage on any Charisma (Performance) check you make that involves you dancing.
Your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Charisma modifiers
When you spend a Bardic Inspiration as an Action, Bonus Action or Reaction, you can make an Unarmored Strike as part of it.
You can apply the Dexterity modifier instead of the Strenght modifier to your Unarmed Strikes. You deal 1d{{bardic-inspiration:dice}}+{{dexterity:modifier}} Bludgeoning Damages.
